managewiki-setting-wgAbuseFilterActions-: The possible actions that can be taken by abuse filters. When adding a new action, check if it is restricted in $wgAbuseFilterRestrictions and, if it is, don't forget to add the abusefilter-modify-restricted right to the appropriate user groups.
managewiki-setting-wgAutoBlockExpiry-hel: Number of seconds before autoblock entries expire. Minimum value allowed is 0 where as maximum is 10 years (315360000).
managewiki-setting-wgBlockAllowsUTEdit-n: Allows blocking users to restrict talk page accesst
managewiki-setting-wgBlockAllowsUTEdit-h: Allows the blocking user to grant talk page edit access for the blocked user
managewiki-setting-wgCookieSetOnAutobloc: Determines whether to set a cookie when a user is autoblocked. Doing so means that a blocked user, even after logging out and moving to a new IP address, will still be blocked.
managewiki-setting-wgCookieSetOnIpBlock-: Determines whether to set a cookie when an IP user is blocked. Doing so means that a blocked user, even after moving to a new IP address, will still be blocked.
managewiki-setting-wgEmailConfirmToEdit-: Require users to confirm email address before they can edit. This effectively disables IP editing.
managewiki-setting-wgProtectSiteLimit-he: Maximum time allowed for protection of the site.
managewiki-setting-wmgSimpleFlaggedRevsU: When enabled, this will only distinguish "checked", "quality", and unreviewed.
managewiki-setting-wmgFlaggedRevsLowProf: For visitors, only show tags/icons for unreviewed/outdated pages when enabled.
managewiki-setting-wgEchoUseCrossWikiBet: Enable Echo Cross Wiki Beta Feature
Feature flag for the cross-wiki notifications beta feature.
managewiki-setting-wgMediaViewerIsInBeta: This makes Media Viewer a beta feature thus this will not be enabled for all users.
managewiki-setting-wgPopupsBetaFeature-h: This enables Popups as a beta feature, rather than showing it to all users.
managewiki-setting-wgVisualEditorEnableD: Enable VisualEditor Diff Page Beta Feature
Enable the new visual mode as a beta feature on revision difference pages.
managewiki-setting-wgVisualEditorEnableW: Enable the new wikitext mode inside the visual editor as a beta feature. It has many of the tools present in the visual editor, uses a similar design, and allows better switching between the two.
managewiki-setting-wgVisualEditorShowBet: Shows a beta welcome for users of VisualEditor.
managewiki-setting-wgChatLinkUsernames-h: Link to user pages in the main chat window
managewiki-setting-wgChatMeCommand-help: Enable "/me <text>" command that prints a status-type message.
managewiki-setting-wmgWebChatServer-help: IRC Server to connect to, not required when using the LiberaChat web client.
managewiki-setting-wmgWebChatClient-help: This sets the web client to use. If you are not using Libera.Chat, select Other Server.
managewiki-setting-wmgWikiLicense-help: Each wiki on Miraheze is by default licensed under CC-BY-SA 4.0 although this can be changed to another supported license. If you would like to release the contributions on your wiki under another license, please let us know so that we can make it available to you. Be aware that changing the license on your wiki can have an impact on your community and should not be done lightly.
managewiki-setting-wgRCMaxAge-help: Items in the recentchanges table are periodically purged; entries older than this many seconds will go.
managewiki-setting-wgActiveUserDays-help: The number of days within which a person must make edits to be considered an "active" user.
managewiki-setting-wgRCLinkDays-help: List days options to list in the Special:Recentchanges and Special:Recentchangeslinked pages.
managewiki-setting-wgCommentsInRecentCha: Shows comments in the RecentChanges special page.
managewiki-setting-wgCommentsSortDescend: This sorts comments by descending date, with the new comment box and most recent comments at the top when enabled.
managewiki-setting-wgEnableScaryTransclu: Allow templates to be imported/transcluded from another wiki.
managewiki-setting-wmgVisualEditorEnable: Make VisualEditor the default editor for all
This will make VisualEditor the default edit for all.
managewiki-setting-wgVisualEditorEnableW: This option allow you to read Wikitext syntax on VisualEditor.
managewiki-setting-wgVisualEditorUseSing: Shows only the "edit" tab. Uses VisualEditor by default if "Make VisualEditor the default editor for all" is set, otherwise defaults to Wikitext.
managewiki-setting-wgAllowSlowParserFunc: Parser functions are "magic words" that return a value or function, such as time, site details or page names.
managewiki-setting-wgPFEnableStringFunct: This option adds support a couple of functions for basic string handling. Example: #pos function returns the position of a given search term within the string. You can learn more in MediaWiki's documentation page https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Module:String.
managewiki-setting-wmgAllowEntityImport-: Allow importing entities via Special:Import and importDump.php.
managewiki-setting-wmgEnableEntitySearch: To determine if entity search UI should be enabled or not.
managewiki-setting-wgRestrictDisplayTitl: Restrict {{DISPLAYTITLE}} to titles that normalize to the same canonical database key. Wikis with NoTitle extension installed have this config unset.
managewiki-setting-wgCapitalLinks-help: Unset this to avoid forcing the first letter of links to capitals.
managewiki-setting-wgEnableCanonicalServ: Output a <link rel="canonical"> tag on every page indicating the canonical server which should be used, i.e. $wgServer or $wgCanonicalServer.
managewiki-setting-wgPageCreationLog-hel: Whether to maintain a log of new page creations, which can be viewed at Special:Log/create.
managewiki-setting-wgMSCS_WarnNoCategori: By default, if you try to save a page that has no categories assigned, MsCatSelect will ask for confirmation. If you wish to avoid this, unset this option.
managewiki-setting-wgCodeEditorEnableCor: To disable the editor on JavaScript and CSS pages in the MediaWiki, User and other core namespaces, unset this option.
managewiki-setting-wgScribuntoUseCodeEdi: Set this to use it when editing Module pages.
managewiki-setting-wgMetaNamespace-help: Name used for the project namespace. Note that the namespace must exist in ManageWiki/namespaces.
managewiki-setting-wgMetaNamespaceTalk-h: Name used for the project talk namespace. Note that the namespace must exist in ManageWiki/namespaces.
managewiki-setting-wgUserBoard-help: Displays UserBoard-related things on social profile pages.
managewiki-setting-wgUserProfileDisplay-: Enables default stuff to display on social profile pages by default
managewiki-setting-wgWikiForumLogsInRC-h: Toggles the display of WikiForum logs in Special:RecentChanges
managewiki-setting-wgWikiForumAllowAnony: Allow Anonymous (users who are not logged in) to use WikiForum
managewiki-setting-wgRCWatchCategoryMemb: Treat Category Membership as a RecentChange
Shows changes to category membership as an action in Special:RecentChanges
managewiki-setting-egApprovedRevsAutomat: Uncheck this box to require new revisions to be manually approved even if made by an administrator
managewiki-setting-wgExternalLinkTarget-: Set a default target for external links.
managewiki-setting-wgRottenLinksCurlTime: Number of seconds before a RottenLinks request returns no response. Min: 10. Max: 120.
managewiki-setting-wgLocaltimezone-help: This will adapt your wikis time over clock to whatever timezone you choose for all users, however it can be changed through user's preferences.
managewiki-setting-wgULSAnonCanChangeLan: Allow anonymous users to change language
Enabling allows anonymous users to control the language they view the wiki in.
managewiki-setting-wgPageLanguageUseDB-h: Allows to change the page language for MediaWiki pages.
managewiki-setting-wgKartographerUseMark: Allows Kartographer to extract CSS style to be used by the link from the GeoJSON.
managewiki-setting-wgEnableUploads-help: Check or uncheck this option if you want to enable or disable the upload of files on your wiki.
managewiki-setting-wgAllowCopyUploads-he: By default Miraheze enables file upload only from a local media but with this option you can upload files remotely from other sites.
managewiki-setting-wgCopyUploadsFromSpec: Enable File Uploads Through URL on Special:Upload
This option adds a textbox on Special:Upload enabling you to upload files from any URL.
managewiki-setting-wgUseInstantCommons-h: This option allows you to use the WikiMedia Commons file database on your wiki.
managewiki-setting-wgMirahezeCommons-hel: This option allows you to use the Miraheze Commons file database on your wiki.
managewiki-setting-wgShowArchiveThumbnai: Show Old Thumbnails On Description Page
Whether to show thumbnails for old images on the image's description page.
managewiki-setting-wgAllowExternalImages: Determines whether or not MediaWiki will allow external images to be rendered inline with text
managewiki-setting-wgAllowImageTag-help: Allow img tag to be used in wikitext.
managewiki-setting-wgSVGConverter-help: This picks the converter to convert Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) to PNG. You may want to choose Inkscape if your SVG->PNG conversion results in a black image.
managewiki-setting-wgMSU_checkAutoCat-he: If set, sets the checkbox for adding a category to a page by default.
managewiki-setting-wgMSU_confirmReplace-: If set, shows the "Replace file" checkbox.
managewiki-setting-wgMSU_showAutoCat-hel: If set, files uploaded while editing a category page will be added to that category.
managewiki-setting-wgMSU_useDragDrop-hel: If set, the drag & drop area will be shown.
managewiki-setting-wgCommonsMetadataForc: Set this to true to force CommonsMetadata to parse the description page of the image and extract the metadata when using images from other wikis.
managewiki-setting-wgCookieWarningMoreUr: Set the URL to your 'More Information' page.
managewiki-setting-wgEchoCrossWikiNotifi: Whether to enable the cross-wiki notifications feature.
managewiki-setting-wmgSiteNoticeOptOut-n: Opt out of global Miraheze notices
managewiki-setting-wmgSiteNoticeOptOut-h: Opts your wiki out of global Miraheze notices, only showing important notices.
managewiki-setting-wgModerationNotificat: If set, notification email will be sent to "Moderation Email" each time an edit is queued for moderation.
If set, only notify about new pages (but not about edits in existing pages).
managewiki-setting-wgDismissableSiteNoti: This allows to set whether or not it should be possible for anonymous visitors of the wiki to dismiss the site notice shown.
managewiki-setting-wgServer-help: By default your wiki is available at https://yourwiki.miraheze.org - a subdomain of Miraheze but you can request us to redirect your wiki to a domain you own. Right now is not yet possible to do it without assistance from our sysadmins, but you can learn more here https://meta.miraheze.org/wiki/Custom_domains
managewiki-setting-wgMobileUrlTemplate-h: This sets your mobile URL. Defaults to [domain].
managewiki-setting-wgDefaultRobotPolicy-: Allows specifying the default robot policy for all pages on the wiki.
managewiki-setting-wgModerationEmail-hel: Sets the email for notifications to go to.
managewiki-setting-wgAccountCreationThro: Number of accounts each IP address may create, 0 to disable.
managewiki-setting-wgSVGMetadataCutoff-h: Don't read SVG metadata beyond this point.
managewiki-setting-wgMaxImageArea-help: Specifies the max pixels you can have in a image.
managewiki-setting-wgFileExtensions-help: This is the list of preferred extensions for uploading files. Uploading files with extensions not selected in this list will trigger a warning.
managewiki-setting-wgDefaultSkin-help: This change the visual interface to the selected skin for all users, however it can be changed through user's preferences.
managewiki-setting-wgLogo-help: This will replace Miraheze's default logo. See https://meta.miraheze.org/wiki/ManageWiki#How_do_I_change_my_logo.2Ffavicon.3F for how you can change it.
managewiki-setting-wgFavicon-help: A favicon is a shortcut image that is displayed on your visitor's browser address bar and in the bookmarks page. Most often it is a smaller version of the logo. See https://meta.miraheze.org/wiki/ManageWiki#How_do_I_change_my_logo.2Ffavicon.3F for how you can add one.
managewiki-setting-wgAppleTouchIcon-help: Favicon for Apple mobile devices. See https://meta.miraheze.org/wiki/ManageWiki#How_do_I_change_my_logo.2Ffavicon.3F on how you can add one.
managewiki-setting-wgMetrolookDownArrow-: This configuration variable has to be true for the tiles to be generated.
managewiki-setting-wgMetrolookUploadButt: When enabled, an "Upload file" link is generated in the top menu bar, before the content-specific action links ("History", "Discussion", etc.)
managewiki-setting-wgMetrolookBartile-he: When "Metrolook Down Arrow" is enabled and "Metrolook Bartile" is enabled, the tile menu will be generated from [[MediaWiki:Metrolook-tiles]]. If "Metrolook Down Arrow" is not set and "Metrolook Bartile" is not set, then the tile menu will be generated from [[MediaWiki:Metrolook-tiles-second]]
managewiki-setting-wgMetrolookMobile-hel: When enabled, makes the UI responsive on mobiles.
managewiki-setting-wgMetrolookUseIconWat: When enabled, it uses an icon for the watch/unwatch button.
managewiki-setting-wgMetrolookLine-help: If not set, then the img.line element (white divider line in the top menu, between the site name and the down arrow/"Upload file" link) won't be generated.
managewiki-setting-wgRelatedArticlesFoot: List of skin names (e.g. "minerva", "vector") where related articles will be shown in the footer.
managewiki-setting-wgMultiBoilerplateDip: if set, will add to the wiki a page named Special:Boilerplates that shows the currently configured boilerplates.
managewiki-setting-wgAllowUserCss-help: Allow user Cascading Style Sheets (CSS). For example User:<user>/*.css.
managewiki-setting-wgAllowUserJs-help: Allow user JavaScript pages. For example User:<user>/*.js.
managewiki-setting-wgDefaultTheme-help: Sets which theme is displayed by default when users visit your wiki.
managewiki-setting-wgManageWikiForceSide: Force the display of ManageWiki links in the sidebar for all users. The link text will differ for nonprivileged users.
